sentence.idiomatic: Have you graduated from university?
When did he graduate from university?
After I graduate from university I would like to go to England.
Mr. Li just came back form Beijing.
They've just graduated.
We've just started the meeting.
I came from the United States.
Did he graduate from Peking University?
I came over from Mr. Wang's office.
What is his major?
Is Ms. Li an English major?
My major is not business management.
I would like to study business management.
Learning business management is very useful.
His management ability is not good.
I plan to go to England to study English.
I don't understand this plan.
After graduation he plans to get married.
You're right. Please continue.
Why doesn't he continue his studies?
Would you like to go to the U.S. to study or go to the U.K.?
Would you like to drink tea or coffee?
I don't know if I should eat beef or chicken.
It's not easy to find a job now.
When will he start looking for a job?
After I graduate I'll look for a job.
Does Mr. Wang work at an international company?
After graduation I'd like to work at an international company.
Is this an international company?
This opportunity is not bad.
Now there are not many work opportunities.
Are there opportunities to work here?
Have you graduated from university Miss Li?
I just graduated. I graduated from Shanghai University. My major is business administration.
Fantastic! What are your plans? Do you want to continue studying or find a job?
I don’t want to continue studying. My plan is to work in an international company.
That’s a pretty good plan. There are a lot of job opportunities in Shanghai.

word.literal: take the master degree entrance exam
